abstract: A column in a data frame.
overview:

A column is a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Collection] that contains values of a specific type, including:

Each element in a column is an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Optional] of the column’s type. Each `nil` element represents a missing value.

# Column

**Structure**

A column in a data frame.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Column<WrappedElement>
```

## Overview

A column is a [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Collection] that contains values of a specific type, including:

- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Int]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Double]
- [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/String]

Each element in a column is an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/Optional] of the column’s type. Each `nil` element represents a missing value.

## Creating a Column

- **init(name:capacity:)**: Creates a column with a name and a capacity.
- **init(_:capacity:)**: Creates a column with a column identifier and a capacity.
- **init(name:contents:)**: Creates a column with a name and a sequence of nonoptional values.
- **init(name:contents:)**: Creates a column with a name and a sequence of optional values.
- **init(_:contents:)**: Creates a column with an identifier and a sequence of nonoptional values.
- **init(_:contents:)**: Creates a column with a column identifier and a sequence of optional values.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a column from a column slice.

## Creating a Column of the Same Type

- **prototype**: A prototype that creates type-erased columns with the same underlying type as the column slice.

## Creating a Type-Erased Column

- **eraseToAnyColumn()**: Generates a type-erased copy of the column.

## Creating Transformed Columns

- **map(_:)**: Creates a new column by applying a transformation to every element.
- **mapNonNil(_:)**: Creates a new column by applying the transformation to every element that isn’t missing.

## Inspecting a Column

- **name**: The name of the column.
- **count**: The number of elements in the column.
- **missingCount**: The number of missing elements in the column.
- **Column.Element**: The type of the column’s elements, which is an optional type of the column’s type.
- **wrappedElementType**: The underlying type of the column’s elements.

## Transforming a Column

- **transform(_:)**: Applies a transformation to every element that isn’t missing.
- **transform(_:)**: Applies a transformation to every element in the column.

## Adding Elements

- **append(_:)**: Appends a nonoptional value to the column.
- **append(_:)**: Appends an optional value to the column.
- **append(contentsOf:)**: Appends a sequence of nonoptional values to the column.
- **append(contentsOf:)**: Appends a sequence of optional values to the column.

## Finding an Element Index

- **argmin()**: Returns the index of the element with the lowest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **argmax()**: Returns the index of the element with the highest value, ignoring missing elements.

## Removing an Element

- **remove(at:)**: Removes an element from the column.

## Accessing Elements

- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses an element at an index.
- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses a contiguous range of elements with a range expression.
- **subscript(_:)**: Accesses a contiguous range of elements.

## Creating a Slice of Unique Elements

- **distinct()**: Generates a discontiguous slice that contains unique elements.

## Creating a Slice by Masking Elements

- **subscript(_:)**: Returns a column slice that includes elements that correspond to a collection of Booleans.

## Encoding a Column

- **encoded(using:)**: Generates a column by encoding each element’s value.

## Decoding a Column

- **decoded(_:using:)**: Generates a column by decoding each element’s data.

## Summarizing a Column

- **summary()**: Generates a categorical summary of the column’s elements.
- **numericSummary()**: Generates a numeric summary of the integer column’s elements.
- **numericSummary()**: Generates a numeric summary of the floating-point column’s elements.

## Getting Statistical Values

- **sum()**: Returns the sum of the column’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **min()**: Returns the element with the lowest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **max()**: Returns the element with the highest value, ignoring missing elements.
- **mean()**: Returns the mean average of the integer column’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **mean()**: Returns the mean average of the floating-point column’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **standardDeviation(deltaDegreesOfFreedom:)**: Returns the standard deviation of the integer column’s elements, ignoring missing elements.
- **standardDeviation(deltaDegreesOfFreedom:)**: Returns the standard deviation of the floating-point column’s elements, ignoring missing elements.

## Describing a Column

- **description**: A text representation of the column.
- **debugDescription**: A text representation of the column suitable for debugging.
- **customMirror**: A mirror that reflects the column.

## Modifying a Column with a Value

- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by adding a value to each element.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by subtracting a value from each element.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by multiplying each element by a value.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column by dividing each element by a value.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column by dividing each element by a value.

## Modifying a Column with a Collection of Values

- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by adding each value in a collection to the corresponding element in the column.
- **+=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by adding each optional value in a collection to the corresponding element in the column.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by subtracting each value in a collection from the corresponding element in the column.
- **-=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by subtracting each optional value in a collection from the corresponding element in the column.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by multiplying each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- ***=(_:_:)**: Modifies a column by multiplying each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies an integer column by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding value in a collection.
- **/=(_:_:)**: Modifies a floating-point column by dividing each element in the column by the corresponding optional value in a collection.

## Instance Methods

- **withContiguousMutableStorageIfAvailable(_:)**: Call `body(buffer)`, where `buffer` provides access to the non-optional contiguous mutable storage of the entire column. If the column contains missing values, `body` is not called and `nil` is returned.
- **withContiguousStorageIfAvailable(_:)**: Call `body(buffer)`, where `buffer` provides access to the non-optional contiguous storage of the entire column. If the column contains missing values, `body` is not called and `nil` is returned.

## Default Implementations

- **BidirectionalCollection Implementations**
- **CustomDebugStringConvertible Implementations**
- **CustomReflectable Implementations**
- **CustomStringConvertible Implementations**
- **MutableCollection Implementations**
- **Sequence Implementations**

## Typed Columns

- **ColumnSlice**: A collection that represents a selection of contiguous elements from a typed column.
- **FilledColumn**: A view on a column that replaces missing elements with a default value.
- **DiscontiguousColumnSlice**: A collection that represents a selection, potentially with gaps, of elements from a typed column.
- **ColumnProtocol**: A type that represents a column.
- **OptionalColumnProtocol**: A type that represents a column that has missing values.

## Conforms To

- BidirectionalCollection
- Collection
- ColumnProtocol
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- MutableCollection
- OptionalColumnProtocol
- RandomAccessCollection
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- Sequence
